update.description:
This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded \(\`/world/default/pose/info\` topic\).

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

Fixed. **~~Intermittent bug~~**~~: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in~~ `Configure()`~~:~~

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #184 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
update.title: [Acropolis] Add logging

content.raw: Working great! Let's get this in and add a playback test in a future PR.
content.html: Working great! Let's get this in and add a playback test in a future PR.

content.raw: Issue #17 created for this.
content.html: Issue #17 created for this.

content.raw:
Merged #216 in fa07997.

A possible cause for the brightness only being exhibited in `dbl_pendulum` could be that this world uses `<engine>ogre2</engine>`under `<gui>`, and the other two example files use `ogre`. If I change the shapes world to `ogre2` too, then it exhibits the same thing - dim during recording, bright during playback. `<gui>` isn't used during playback - currently only the lights and models in the SDF are recreated in playback. Maybe the `<gui>` has to be re-created in `LogPlayback.cc` as well. Not sure how to do that... There is `sdfWorld->Gui()`, but there isn't a `SdfEntityCreator::CreateEntities(sdf::Gui)`.
content.html:
Merged #216 in fa07997.

A possible cause for the brightness only being exhibited in dbl_pendulum could be that this world uses <engine>ogre2</engine>under <gui>, and the other two example files use ogre. If I change the shapes world to ogre2 too, then it exhibits the same thing - dim during recording, bright during playback. <gui> isn't used during playback - currently only the lights and models in the SDF are recreated in playback. Maybe the <gui> has to be re-created in LogPlayback.cc as well. Not sure how to do that... There is sdfWorld->Gui(), but there isn't a SdfEntityCreator::CreateEntities(sdf::Gui).

update.description:
This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded \(\`/world/default/pose/info\` topic\).

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

Fixed. **~~Intermittent bug~~**~~: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in~~ `Configure()`~~:~~

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #184 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
update.title: [Acropolis] Add logging

content.raw:
I have some suggestions on pull request #216.

This is good to go for me, there's only one weird bug left which I haven't been able to figure out. When playing back the `dbl_pendulum` world, for some reason the whole scene is brighter. I'm not sure if the issue is in the light or the materials. It looks to me that there's a single light being loaded and it has the exact same specs as the original light (except for an extra `<spot>` element which I deleted and didn't change anything). The materials also seem to be the same.
content.html:
I have some suggestions on pull request #216.

This is good to go for me, there's only one weird bug left which I haven't been able to figure out. When playing back the dbl_pendulum world, for some reason the whole scene is brighter. I'm not sure if the issue is in the light or the materials. It looks to me that there's a single light being loaded and it has the exact same specs as the original light (except for an extra <spot> element which I deleted and didn't change anything). The materials also seem to be the same.

content.raw: Should we clear `nameToPose` at the end of `ParsePose`? And if we should, maybe `nameToPose` could just be a variable local to the function instead of a member variable of the system.
content.html: Should we clear nameToPose at the end of ParsePose? And if we should, maybe nameToPose could just be a variable local to the function instead of a member variable of the system.

content.raw:
Ideally we would use `pose.id()` instead of name, because IDs are unique. This way it should be possible to playback links from different models even if they're all called `link`.

One caveat here though is that we have no way to be sure that the recorded IDs match the playback IDs, since the playback is not controlling the creation of entities.

Until we have a better solution than saving the whole SDF file and loading it back, here are some alternatives I can think of:

* Assume that the entities in log and playback will be the same and use IDs. We can do some rough checks to make sure they match, like also checking the name and just fail if they don't.
* Keep a map of the IDs from the log file to the playback. This will need to be updated for all newly created entities. I feel like in the long run we should be playing back with the same IDs as when the file was recorded though, for repeatability.

Maybe there's some other alternative?
content.html:
Ideally we would use pose.id() instead of name, because IDs are unique. This way it should be possible to playback links from different models even if they're all called link.

One caveat here though is that we have no way to be sure that the recorded IDs match the playback IDs, since the playback is not controlling the creation of entities.

Until we have a better solution than saving the whole SDF file and loading it back, here are some alternatives I can think of:

  • Assume that the entities in log and playback will be the same and use IDs. We can do some rough checks to make sure they match, like also checking the name and just fail if they don't.
  • Keep a map of the IDs from the log file to the playback. This will need to be updated for all newly created entities. I feel like in the long run we should be playing back with the same IDs as when the file was recorded though, for repeatability.

Maybe there's some other alternative?

content.raw: How about for now, checking the type and if it's not PoseV print a warning that the type is not supported? Just in case someone tries to playback an invalid log.
content.html: How about for now, checking the type and if it's not PoseV print a warning that the type is not supported? Just in case someone tries to playback an invalid log.

content.raw: Fixed in 6c3c240. Didn't realize that `default` was the world name…
content.html: Fixed in 6c3c240. Didn't realize that default was the world name…

content.raw: That's a typo. I keep forgetting to change it back when I change it to \(1\) \(2\) during testing...... Those are automatically created. I guess I should just delete my local `/tmp/log/` after each playback.
content.html: That's a typo. I keep forgetting to change it back when I change it to (1) (2) during testing...... Those are automatically created. I guess I should just delete my local /tmp/log/ after each playback.

content.raw: It's a bit weird that the simulation keeps running after this is printed. Gazebo classic would be capped at the last logged time and never go beyond that. But here the playback is not the one driving time, so we have less control, but at the same time we're more flexible. No action needed, I just wanted to point this out. Once we have a proper playback UI we could make this more transparent to the user.
content.html: It's a bit weird that the simulation keeps running after this is printed. Gazebo classic would be capped at the last logged time and never go beyond that. But here the playback is not the one driving time, so we have less control, but at the same time we're more flexible. No action needed, I just wanted to point this out. Once we have a proper playback UI we could make this more transparent to the user.

content.raw: We should probably use `/tmp/log` by default. Or if we're going to have different demos, they could be recorded to different directories, maybe `/tmp/log_keyboard`
content.html: We should probably use /tmp/log by default. Or if we're going to have different demos, they could be recorded to different directories, maybe /tmp/log_keyboard

content.raw: We shouldn't hardcode the world name here (`default`)
content.html: We shouldn't hardcode the world name here (default)

content.raw: The last time I checked it was almost there, just pending the change to sim time and tests. I'm taking another look now, it should all be addressed.
content.html: The last time I checked it was almost there, just pending the change to sim time and tests. I'm taking another look now, it should all be addressed.

content.html: Where do we stand on this PR?

`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #175 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
update.title: [Acropolis] Add logging

update.description:
This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded \(\`/world/default/pose/info\` topic\).

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

Fixed. **~~Intermittent bug~~**~~: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in~~ `Configure()`~~:~~

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #175 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
update.title: [Acropolis] Add logging

content.raw:
this won't work on macOS right now; it doesn't even have `<experimental/filesystem>` yet

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/issues/137/compiler-support-for-gazebo11#comment-50835611
content.html:
this won't work on macOS right now; it doesn't even have <experimental/filesystem> yet

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/issues/137/compiler-support-for-gazebo11#comment-50835611

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

Fixed. **~~Intermittent bug~~**~~: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in~~ `Configure()`~~:~~

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #175 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
update.title: [Blueprint] Add logging
